page.title: 02A MINER'S JOB - KILNHURST
page.content: A pit is dark and dusty. Some places are hot and others are cold. Some places are dry and some are damp. Some places are lit up, especially the pit bottom. First a miner has to put on his work clothes. He puts on overalls, helmet, boots, belt and lamp. Next he will go down the pit shaft on a lift called a chair or cage. He then goes to his work place by riding on a paddymail, or walking. A paddymail is an underground train pulled by a steel rope and driven by an electric engine. Next he starts work. My father installs signalling systems for paddymails and rope haulages. He uses pliers, spanners, screwdrivers and wire tensioners. When work is finished he goes back to the pit bottom and rides the shaft. Then he has a shower and puts on clean clothes. Finally he goes home.
